message.content:
I have recently made some changes to Coryphaeus repo, where I added a app switcher drop down menu to the navigation bar.\
\
Intranet and Bookkeeper repos were cloned from earlier versions of Coryphaeus.  Please Update Intranet and Bookkeeper to incorporate the newly added App Switch Drop Down Menu.... However, you should make adjustments because in the Intranet app, the top button in the drop down menu should be Intranet, not Home;  Simillarly, in the Book Keeper app, the top button from which the drop down menu spans should be Book Keeper; not Home.

content.text: I'll help you update the Intranet and Bookkeeper repositories to incorporate the App Switcher dropdown menu from Coryphaeus, with the appropriate customizations for each app.

todos.content: Examine the App Switcher implementation in Coryphaeus
Update Intranet navigation to include App Switcher with 'Intranet' as top button
Update Bookkeeper navigation to include App Switcher with 'Book Keeper' as top button
Test the App Switcher functionality in both apps

content.content: Todos have been modified successfully. Ensure that you continue to use the todo list to track your progress. Please proceed with the current tasks if applicable

Update Bookkeeper navigation to include App Switcher with 'Book Keeper' as top button
Test the App Switcher functionality in both apps

content.text: Now I need to update the Intranet AppSidebar.vue to include the App Switcher dropdown like in Coryphaeus, but with "Intranet" as the top button instead of "Home". Let me first copy the updated AppSwitcher from Coryphaeus to Intranet:

content.content: The file C:\Users\Brahm\Git\Intranet\src\components\AppSwitcher.vue has been updated. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file: 1‚Üí 32‚Üí 33‚Üí

input.old_string:
<script setup>
import { useAuthStore } from '../stores/auth'

const authStore = useAuthStore()

// Available apps configuration - in production this could come from team settings
const availableApps = [
  {
    name: 'Intranet',
    subdomain: 'intranet',
    description: 'Internal portal and resources',
    icon: 'üìã'
  },
  {
    name: 'Bookkeeping',
    subdomain: 'bookkeeping',
    description: 'Financial documents and records',
    icon: 'üìÅ'
  },
  {
    name: 'Files',
    subdomain: 'files',
    description: 'Document management',
    icon: 'üìÑ'
  }
]

// Get the base domain from environment
const baseDomain = import.meta.env.VITE_APP_DOMAIN || 'localhost:3000'

/**
 * Generate URL for an app subdomain
 */
const getAppUrl = (subdomain) => {
  // For local development
  if (baseDomain.includes('localhost')) {
    const port = baseDomain.split(':')[1] || '3000'
    return `http://${subdomain}.localhost:${port}`
  }
  
  // For production
  return `https://${subdomain}.${baseDomain}`
}

/**
 * Check if current app matches the subdomain
 */
const isCurrentApp = (subdomain) => {
  const currentHost = window.location.hostname
  return currentHost.includes(subdomain)
}

/**
 * Handle app switching with analytics/logging
 */
const handleAppSwitch = (app) => {
  // Log app switch for analytics
  console.log(`Switching to app: ${app.name}`)
  
  // In the future, you could add analytics tracking here
  // analytics.track('app_switch', { from: getCurrentApp(), to: app.name })
}
</script>
input.new_string:
<script setup>
import { useAuthStore } from '../stores/auth'

const authStore = useAuthStore()

// Available apps configuration - matches the roadmap specs
const availableApps = [
  {
    name: 'BookKeeper',
    subdomain: 'bookkeeping',
    description: 'Financial documents and records',
    icon: 'üìö',
    port: '5174'
  },
  {
    name: 'Coryphaeus',
    subdomain: 'files',
    description: 'File management system',
    icon: 'üé≠',
    port: '5173'
  }
]

// Get the base domain from environment
const baseDomain = import.meta.env.VITE_APP_DOMAIN || 'localhost:3000'

/**
 * Generate URL for an app subdomain
 */
const getAppUrl = (subdomain) => {
  // Find the app configuration for the subdomain
  const app = availableApps.find(a => a.subdomain === subdomain)
  
  // For local development - use specific ports
  if (baseDomain.includes('localhost')) {
    const port = app?.port || '5173'
    return `http://localhost:${port}`
  }
  
  // For production
  return `https://${subdomain}.${baseDomain}`
}

/**
 * Handle app switching with analytics/logging
 */
const handleAppSwitch = (app) => {
  // Log app switch for analytics
  console.log(`Switching to app: ${app.name}`)
  
  // In the future, you could add analytics tracking here
  // analytics.track('app_switch', { from: getCurrentApp(), to: app.name })
}
</script>

<script setup>
import { useAuthStore } from '../stores/auth'

const authStore = useAuthStore()

// Available apps configuration - matches the roadmap specs
const availableApps = [
  {
    name: 'BookKeeper',
    subdomain: 'bookkeeping',
    description: 'Financial documents and records',
    icon: 'üìö',
    port: '5174'
  },
  {
    name: 'Coryphaeus',
    subdomain: 'files',
    description: 'File management system',
    icon: 'üé≠',
    port: '5173'
  }
]

// Get the base domain from environment
const baseDomain = import.meta.env.VITE_APP_DOMAIN || 'localhost:3000'

/**
 * Generate URL for an app subdomain
 */
const getAppUrl = (subdomain) => {
  // Find the app configuration for the subdomain
  const app = availableApps.find(a => a.subdomain === subdomain)
  
  // For local development - use specific ports
  if (baseDomain.includes('localhost')) {
    const port = app?.port || '5173'
    return `http://localhost:${port}`
  }
  
  // For production
  return `https://${subdomain}.${baseDomain}`
}

/**
 * Handle app switching with analytics/logging
 */
const handleAppSwitch = (app) => {
  // Log app switch for analytics
  console.log(`Switching to app: ${app.name}`)
  
  // In the future, you could add analytics tracking here
  // analytics.track('app_switch', { from: getCurrentApp(), to: app.name })
}
</script>

input.old_string:
<style scoped>
.app-switcher {
  @apply bg-white border border-gray-200 rounded-lg shadow-md;
  min-width: 280px;
}

.app-switcher-header {
  @apply px-4 py-3 border-b border-gray-200;
}

.app-list {
  @apply divide-y divide-gray-100;
}

.app-item {
  @apply flex items-center px-4 py-3 hover:bg-gray-50 transition-colors;
  @apply text-decoration-none;
}

.app-item.current {
  @apply bg-blue-50 hover:bg-blue-50;
}

.app-icon {
  @apply text-2xl mr-3 flex-shrink-0;
}

.app-details {
  @apply flex-1 min-w-0;
}

.app-name {
  @apply text-sm font-medium text-gray-900;
}

.app-description {
  @apply text-xs text-gray-500 mt-1;
}

.current-indicator {
  @apply ml-2 flex-shrink-0;
}

.team-info {
  @apply px-4 py-2 border-t border-gray-200 bg-gray-50;
}
</style>

input.new_string:
<script>
import AppSwitcher from '../AppSwitcher.vue'

export default {
  name: 'AppSidebar',
  components: {
    AppSwitcher
  }
};
</script>

<style scoped>
/* Hide the dropdown when the sidebar is not hovered */
#app-sidebar:not(.group):not(:hover) .group-focus-within\:block {
  display: none !important;
}

/* Alternative approach - hide dropdown when sidebar collapses */
#app-sidebar:not(:hover) [class*="group-focus-within:block"] {
  display: none !important;
}
</style>

};
</script>

<style scoped>
/* Hide the dropdown when the sidebar is not hovered */
#app-sidebar:not(.group):not(:hover) .group-focus-within\:block {
  display: none !important;
}

/* Alternative approach - hide dropdown when sidebar collapses */
#app-sidebar:not(:hover) [class*="group-focus-within:block"] {
  display: none !important;
}
</style>
